intro: Aster anomalus f. albidus, commonly known as the white aster, is a variant of the common aster species native to Europe and parts of Asia. This plant is characterized by its pale to white flower heads, which contrast with the typical purple or blue hues of the species. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. The foliage is usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and can thrive in well-drained soils.
